about the role

role: business intelligence chapter lead

team: new zealand data

job type: permanent, 4.2

job location: manyata tech park, bengaluru

at anz our purpose is to shape a world where people and communities thrive. anz new zealand is creating a data hub in bengaluru covering all the functions in data covering customer remediation, data warehousing, business intelligence and analytics.

as a chapter lead, you will be a subject matter expert in your field (engineer or business intelligence). you will grow and develop the capability of others in your discipline and will have direct people leadership responsibility for 5 – 9-chapter members. you will also contribute to the delivery of data priorities, dedicating ~20-30% of your time to squad work. this may include providing sme input, reviewing design decisions, and coaching squad members to resolve challenges, as well as more “hands on” complex business analysis, data sourcing, modelling or visualisation work.

what will your day look like

owning the frameworks, standards, and practices for chapter members to follow in their squad work (or for engineering chapter leads, cascading the frameworks, standards and practices defined by the principal engineer).

where required, working with the principal engineer and other chapter leads to develop templates, guidelines, frameworks, and other such materials to help promote the adoption of and adherence to best practice in your discipline.

providing thought leadership and coaching others in leading best-practice approaches.

contributing to project deliverables, working across squads to provide sme input and quality assurance (at around ~20-30% of your capacity).

acting as an escalation point for complex or challenging data questions relating to your discipline.

establishing a strong community and positive workplace culture that promotes learning and continuous improvement.

identifying new or innovative ways of delivering work in your discipline (e.g., through automation or simplification).

people management accountabilities of chapter members, this includes providing feedback, support, and guidance, proactively managing underperformance, applying organisation policy and maintaining accurate employee people data in hr systems.

partnering with platform owners and product owners to understand and plan for chapter capability needs and align chapter members to squads based on their skill set and ambitions.

what will you bring?

the ‘must have’ knowledge, skill and experience (kse) the role requires are:

deep technical skills in your field/discipline.
people leadership experience including coaching, team building and leading through change.
experience line managing up to ~5-9 direct reports.
an understanding of agile methodologies and how they can be applied to deliver data engineering and business intelligence outcomes.
excellent written and verbal communication skills.
ability to challenge the status quo and identify alternate solutions.

additional business intelligence chapter lead kse

5+ years working in analytics, bi or technology, including exposure to tools such as tableau, wherescape red, powershell, bitbucket and sql
a strong understanding of the etl development lifecycle using wherescape red (discovery, data modelling, sourcing, development, testing and quality assurance)
a strong understanding of data modelling techniques, in particular kimball methodologies

the ‘good to have’ knowledge, skill and experience (kse) the role requires are:

experience delivering work and leading others in an agile context.
experience delivering data outcomes that drive decision making in a financial services or banking organisation.
experience with apis, containerisation, automation, and ci/cd is highly advantageous.
so, why join us?

our purpose is to shape a world where people and communities thrive. that's why we strive to create balanced, sustainable economy in which everyone can take part and build a better life. by helping people make the most of what they have, we transform ideas, hard work and ambition into reality.

career development means different things to different people. it may simply mean developing a skill, broadening your experience by moving sideways or stretching yourself by moving to a different business. how you manage and develop your career is up to you, but anz is committed to helping you do this by providing you with the support, tools and resources you need.

we work flexibly at anz and encourage you to talk to us about how this role can be flexible for you and any adjustments you may require to our recruitment process or the role itself.

if you are a candidate with a disability, let us know how we can provide you with additional support.

founded in denmark, ramboll is a foundation-owned people company. we have more than 18,000 experts working across our global operations in 35 countries. our experts are leaders in their fields, developing and delivering innovative solutions in diverse markets including buildings, transport, architecture and landscape, water, environment & health, energy, and management consulting. we invite you to contribute to a more sustainable future working in an open, collaborative, and empowering company. combining local experience with global knowledge, we together shape the societies of tomorrow.
work at the heart of sustainable change
ramboll is a global architecture, engineering, and consultancy company. we believe that the purpose of sustainable change is to create a thriving world for both nature and people. so, that’s where we start – and how we work. at ramboll, our core strength is our people, and our history is rooted in a clear vision of how a responsible company should act. being open and curious is a cornerstone of our culture. we embrace an inclusive mindset that looks for fresh, diverse, and innovative perspectives. we respect, embrace, and invite diversity in all forms to actively cultivate an environment where everyone can flourish and realise their full potential.
job description
about the job
we are looking for a talented data analyst to join our ramboll india team, who has a strong belief, passion, and enthusiasm for translating data into meaningful stories.
we invite you to bring your system expertise into play, working with customer data and reporting in ramboll. to succeed in this role, you must have proven experience with data analytics, market research, sizing and modelling in a reputed organization.
inviting bright minds
do you want to push the boundaries of your profession and develop your excellence in an open, collaborative and empowering culture? we work to create a sustainable future and our inspiring projects and innovative solutions aim to set the standard among our peers. you will join a global company that has been growing successfully since its founding in 1945. together, we lead and create positive impacts on societies, companies, and people around the world.
you will join our global design centre
as our new data analyst, you will be part of our journey to professionalize and strengthen our support to the global ramboll organization. you will join the global design centre in chennai, india, a team with a strong passion for delivering high-quality support to colleagues around the world.
the global design centre is tied to the clients, sales & marketing team in the headquarters based in copenhagen, denmark working with client centricity, portfolio management, and strategic marketing. you will also be providing assistance to the global ramboll organization, collaborating and working closely with colleagues across the world.
role overview
the person will work closely with the clients, sales and ,marketing team in denmark to accelerate the journey towards client-centricity in ramboll.
key skills – must have
ability to understand and analyze complex data and convert it into meaningful charts and stories
critical thinking and problem-solving skills
high proficiency in english – both written and oral
solid commercial understanding across sales and projects
analytical thinking and problem-solving attitude and skill
develop reports and facilitate sharing of insights across the organization
deliver data-driven recommendations and reports to executives and stakeholders
merging data from various systems to generate overall insights
being detail-oriented and capable of delivering a high level of accuracy
good knowledge of marketing reporting systems – preferably power bi
good interpersonal skills and ability to work under pressure
proven ability to prioritize work to balance multiple projects and deadlines
should be open to feedback and willing to make changes to her/his work
comfortable with taking ownership of own work while being a committed team player.
experience
8+ years of working experience in a reputed organization
5+ years of experience in working with business and market intelligence.
qualifications
education
graduate/post graduate
additional information
we offer:
a challenging and interesting workday characterized by continuous learning, in an environment where you have many to spar with and learn from.
opportunity to work with varied work tasks, across the organization.
opportunity to develop and influence your own area of responsibility.
personal qualities that will help you succeed in this role include very good communication and coordinating skills and fluency in verbal and written english. an innovative and problem-solving approach to your tasks. enjoy working in a fast-paced environment and have a sense of urgency.
welcome to our support organization
in ramboll’s support organization, we take pride in keeping ramboll running smoothly, enabling bright minds throughout the organization to focus on their areas of expertise as we tie together all parts of the business. we provide support within areas like finance, hr, it, legal, communication, facility management, and more, coordinating efforts and securing common ground for developing and servicing clients and markets.
equality, diversity, and inclusion is at the heart of what we do
we believe in the strength of diversity and know that unique experiences and perspectives are vital for creating truly sustainable societies. therefore, we are committed to providing an inclusive and supportive work environment where everyone can flourish and reach their potential. we welcome applications from candidates of all backgrounds and encourage you to contact our recruitment team to discuss any accommodations you need during the application process.

data analyst about the role:
as a business analyst, you will be a key member of several scrum teams, contributing to the building and development process of several products at the same time. you will be responsible for understanding and documenting business requirements and processes, supporting product owners and scrum teams in creating and delivering solutions, and for the capture and maintenance of product epics and features.

support implementations from ideation through to go-live (including support of testing and associated bugs)

experience using quicksight/power bi/qlikview/tableau

strong data visualisation, design skills, data modelling and data inference skills
excellent communication and interpersonal skills across different disciplines
enjoy collaborating and working in cross-functional environments
excited by building innovative cloud-native payment solutions
strong communicator who enjoys working in teams

compassionate, creative, curious, self-motivated, and not afraid to challenge the status-quo

health: comprehensive health insurance for employee, spouse, two children and parents
accidental insurance for the employee
13 personal days per year + festival holidays. you can also take your birthday off as paid leave, and we offer a paid day off for any charity work you want to participate in

apexx is a dynamic fintech scale-up founded in 2016 with the goal of creating cutting-edge payment technology. our vision is to be the payment industry's most merchant-centric provider. through our platform a merchant can connect via a simple api connection to the world's payment ecosystem, increasing conversion at lower cost and satisfying their entire payments needs. we excel at bringing transparency, efficiency, and competition to the payments market. what's more, we won the 'most disruptive payment technology' award in 2018 for the second consecutive year. no other company has ever retained this award and it demonstrates that apexx is at the forefront of what can be achieved in payments technology.
the team is incredibly committed and enthusiastic about what we are building - top of the class payments solutions and a valuable business. this is infectious and creates a wonderful office atmosphere. we have a supportive, relaxed yet high-performing, and high trust culture.

supply chain data analyst in this role, your responsibilities will be:
develop various analytics related to cost, cash, quality, speed, and capacity which will help the organization to improve overall supply chain efficiency.
use various statistical methods & tools like advance excel, tableau, power bi to provide the various analytics to leadership team for decision making, strategic actions and strategic planning.
interacts with multiple businesses global supply teams & supply leadership and efficiently & innovatively handles supply data systems, new project initiatives etc.
build and provide supply chain analytical reports to the final control leadership team by using tableau and advance excel, on monthly basis to take vital strategic actions.
benchmark outstanding analytics and business intelligence practices, to implement at final control.
develop and maintain key performance metrics and benchmark reports relating to supply chain performance.
analyze purchasing-related information including material purchases, receipts, cost, purchase price variance, and supplier performance
focus resources on continuous improvement of the movement of materials through supply chain part approval processes.
support the development of common processes, systems and templates that provide a comprehensive overview of key information regarding risk mitigation activities that build common understanding among members of multiple businesses supply chain teams.
design / crafts critical metric data visualization reports for supply chain leadership and carry out proactive analytics with actionable insights.
evaluates large volume of supply / logistics raw data which is scattered across multiple files and captures relevant information to perform insightful data analytics.
comfortable in fulfilling ad-hoc & sudden data analytical requirements from supply management and completes the tasks with a sense of urgency and pro-activeness.
ensure timely delivery & error free supply chain critical metric reports, scorecards, dashboard’s & analytics reports.
conducts orientation / user training sessions on supply systems as & when vital.
handle the reporting & analytics activities of the global supply chain team which includes but not limited to:
data prep for gathering, normalizing, reporting & analytics
project tracker
cost savings and inflations
lead-time
ad hoc reporting
key performance indicator (critical metric) dashboard
understand how supply chain metrics relate to each other and the overall goals of the business.
analyze, optimize and standardize supply chain reporting processes across multiple business units.
who you are:
you set daring goals and has high standards. you quickly and conclusively takes action in constantly evolving, unexpected situations. you crucially make high-quality decisions, even when based on incomplete information or in the face of uncertainty. you navigate the political complexities of the organization easily. you are energized when faced with ambiguity and uncertainty. you deliver messages in a clear, compelling, and concise manner.
for this role, you will need:
big data management and analytics
excellent digital literacy and a technical competence that includes strong data gathering skills, expertise, interpretation, and reporting for the supply chain organization.
strong analytical and problem-solving skills with expertise in data analysis and management (advance excel, tableau, power bi, ms excel, ms word, ms access, powerpoint, sql).
strategic sourcing methodology, supply chain management, contracting, procurement, and supplier management foresight required.
experience working with erp systems, preferably sap & oracle.
preferred qualifications that set you apart:
degree or equivalent in supply chain management, engineering, business management or any related field.
proficient in english (both verbal and written) as will be working with overseas teams
certificate in big data management and analytics is a plus

about scrut automation
scrut automation is an information security and compliance monitoring platform, aimed at helping small and medium cloud-native enterprises develop and maintain a robust security posture, and comply with various infosec standards such as soc 2, iso 27001, gdpr, and the like with ease. with the help of the scrut platform, customers reduce their manual effort for security and compliance tasks by 70%, and build real-time visibility of their security posture.

founded by iit/isb/mckinsey alumni, the founding team has over 15 years of combined infosec experience. scrut is built out of india for the world, with customers across india, apac, north america, europe and the middle east. scrut is backed by lightspeed ventures, massmutual ventures and endiya partners, along with prominent angels from the global saas community.

overview of the job profile
business/ customer success analyst will play a key role in driving customer success by nurturing customers in our rapidly growing business. the mission of scrut automation's customer success team is to transform our customer's compliance journey.

become a product expert on scrut automation and how our platform can be used to improve security posture through our standard offerings (soc2, iso27001, pci dss, hipaa, ccpa and gdpr)

problem-solving ability and customer-centric outlook

titles: IT Database Analyst/Sr Data Engineering Analyst (MSSQL)
combined_text:
it database analyst/sr data engineering analyst (mssql) project description
mssql database administrator (dba) is a key member of the it team responsible for managing and maintaining
the organization's microsoft sql server databases. the purpose of this role is to ensure the high availability,
security, and optimal performance of the sql server infrastructure. the senior mssql dba will lead and support
database-related projects, provide technical expertise, and act as a subject matter expert (sme) for mssql-related
matters.
responsibilities
oversee the installation, configuration, and maintenance of mssql server instances across different
environments (development, testing, production).
monitor and tune database performance, query optimization, and indexing to ensure optimal database
response times and overall system efficiency.
implement and maintain database replication, always on , clustering, and backup and recovery strategies to
ensure data availability and business continuity.
implement and enforce security policies and access controls to safeguard sensitive data and maintain
compliance with industry standards and regulations.
diagnose and resolve database-related problems, errors, and performance issues in a timely manner.
forecast future database capacity requirements and recommend necessary infrastructure upgrades.
plan and execute database upgrades, service packs, and patches while minimizing downtime and ensuring
compatibility with existing systems.
develop and maintain automation scripts and processes to streamline routine tasks and database
administration.
work closely with application developers to optimize database schema design and ensure efficient database
access patterns.
create and maintain comprehensive database documentation, including system configurations, procedures,
and policies.
resolve help desk tickets as assigned and provide 24-hour on-call support for problem analysis and resolution
to system problems on a rotational basis.
perform effective and independent incident and problem resolution for databases and applications
job duties
participate in on-call rotation and provide 24/7 support for critical database incidents.
evaluate and recommend new database technologies and solutions to improve the overall database infrastructure.
collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure smooth data migration and integration projects.
stay updated with the latest trends, tools, and techniques in database administration and suggest process
improvements.
skills
must have
5+ years of experience as an mssql database administrator, managing enterprise-level databases.
hands-on experience with mssql server 2008 and above, including performance tuning and optimization.
experience with database backup and recovery strategies, replication, and clustering.
proficiency in t-sql scripting and query optimization.
knowledge of database security best practices and regulatory compliance (e.g., gdpr, hipaa).
seeks innovative ways to improve the process of delivering solutions to customers.
ability to multitask work with multiple clients and sets of requirements concurrently.
meet service level agreements for database uptime and performance.
able to automate the dba tasks and work on self-healing solutions in the dbms area.
help team members to document the standard operating procedures and processes.
in-depth knowledge of mssql server and its various components.
proficiency in database installation, configuration, and maintenance.
ability to optimize database performance and query execution.
experience in setting up replication, clustering, and backup solutions.
knowledge of database security principles and access controls.
familiarity with t-sql scripting and automation using powershell/python/ssis.
• proficiency in using database management tools and monitoring utilities.• strong analytical and troubleshooting skills to identify and resolve database issues.
excellent verbal and written communication skills to collaborate with team members and stakeholders
effectively.
ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and contribute to cross-functional projects.
efficiently manage multiple tasks and prioritize workload to meet deadlines.
adaptability: willingness to adapt to changing technologies and business requirements.
nice to have
microsoft sql server certifications (e.g., mcsa, mcse).
experience with other database management systems like mysql, oracle, or postgresql.
familiarity with cloud database services (e.g., azure sql database, aws rds).
demonstrated commitment to continual learning
languages
english: c2 proficient

senior

if needed, we can help you with relocation process.

lead - business analyst job description:
job title : lead - business analyst
the purpose of this role
this role is within customer solutions chapter operating in workplace investing agile model. lead business analyst is responsible for eliciting and capturing story acceptance criteria, developing, and executing business acceptance test plan, test strategy and implementing solutions to address business needs of medium to high complexity.
the lead business analyst is to leverage upon domain knowledge & strong analytical and problem-solving skills. the role requires a person to be highly motivated, “self-starters” with a sense of ownership, and a strong desire to succeed and possess the ability to work individually as well as within a team structure. you will be a key member of the team working closely with a group of cross-functional, multi-disciplinary, and dedicated squad members responsible for delivering specific business goals.
this position is for the data exchange platform (dex) squad within the employer servicing & integration product area under wi workplace platforms domain. the position is for a lead ba who is 100% dedicated to the dex squad and work closely with the computron (dex dc) and metroplex (peps) squads. this squad manages a platform called as the data exchange platform which is basically a transformation engine for all data feeds we get for employees from clients, payroll vendors and other third parties. this is a product agnostic platform used within wi and have 9+ use cases live in prod on platform. a business analyst would help work with different squads across products to understand the requirements and share with the team to help prioritise the backlog this is going to be a wi common platform to help support dc modernization and would be a critical platform to solve for the single client feed starting next year.
the value you deliver
initiating & leading discovery for feature/epic definition & key decision partners with squad leader and scrum master to prioritize epics and stories.
ensuring epic/story artifacts (i.e. use cases and supporting documentation) are updated and available for story execution
writing stories and facilitate story grooming/refinement sessions to ensure stories meet the definition of ready
collaborating effectively with key business, it, legal, compliance & risk partners to define product features and monitor trends.
establishing stakeholder meetings to include demos of sprint deliverables and impact analysis results (user experience design, legal, outside business groups)
engaging stakeholders in organizational readiness activities through the lifecycle of the project to proactively mitigate risks related to product delivery.
communicating issues and stakeholder feedback to the squad leader in a clear, concise, and timely manner
participating and /or facilitating the daily scrums, sprint planning meetings, release planning, sprint reviews and retrospectives
providing constructive feedback for future process improvements
identifying business requirements, document improvement opportunities, share with scrum team and at ba forums
collaborating with the qa team on qa test plan reviews and provides assistance and guidance to qa with story requirements / acceptance criteria clarifications.
performing end to end business acceptance testing in acceptance region and ensure the traceability of test cases to the story acceptance criteria.
assisting with readiness and deployment activities for each release
the skills that are key to this role
functional / behavioural
good listener and having strong verbal communication skills.
ability to run stakeholder meetings.
should be able to facilitate a workshop or present a requirement to stakeholder.
excellent time management skills to ensure that work is completed on time.
ability to write clear, concise product documentation and communications.
strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to assimilate new information, draw conclusions and communicate ideas.
keep up to date on agile best practices and trends negotiation and influencing skills.
positive attitude and flexible, with a willingness to adapt to the changing needs of the squad.
knowledge of us retirement industry
the skills that are good to have for this role
you should have strong stakeholder management, negotiation and influencing skills, high quality documentation, ability to work independently, strong analytical skills.
knowledge of retirement service industry domain preferred
the expertise we’re looking for
5-6 years of business analyst experience
be, btech, mba or bachelor’s degree preferred.
basic knowledge of business analyst techniques, for example: benchmarking, business rules analysis, risk analysis and user stories, user acceptance testing and product documentation.
experience with jira, confluence, mural, or similar agile backlog management tool preferred.
good understanding on ms office suite: word, excel, visio, powerpoint, and outlook
csm/cspo/ba certification preferred.

customer solutions is a group of business professionals who develop and manage end-to-end market leading solutions to deliver increased customer satisfaction and growth.
our team comprises of business analysts, consultants, squad leaders, and discipline leaders that operate in agile model, owning end to end responsibility for all aspects of the product development lifecycle process. we support retirement services and healthcare business domains.

the human resources data analyst ii is based in coimbatore and responsible for providing the talent acquisition center of excellence support to all areas of our team’s operations. this includes collaborating with regional ta leaders, recruiters, and coordinators to ensure they have the necessary resources and tools to be successful. reporting to the global talent acquisition operations leader and collaborating with the global shared services center, this role is primarily focused on data, reporting and analytics to provide our team with valuable insights to make data driven decisions.

collecting and interpreting data from multiple sources, and spotting patterns and trends within this data.

who we are:
milacron is a global leader in the manufacture, distribution and service of highly engineered and customized systems within the $27 billion plastic technology and processing industry. we are the only global company with a full-line product portfolio that includes hot runner systems, injection molding, extrusion equipment. we maintain strong market positions across these products, as well as leading positions in process control systems, mold bases and components, maintenance, repair and operating (“mro”) supplies for plastic processing equipment. our strategy is to deliver highly customized equipment, components and service to our customers throughout the lifecycle of their plastic processing technology systems. milacron is a operating company of hillenbrand.

hillenbrand (nyse: hi) is a global industrial company that provides highly-engineered, mission-critical processing equipment and solutions to customers in over 100 countries around the world. our portfolio is composed of leading industrial brands that serve large, attractive end markets, including durable plastics, food, and recycling. guided by our purpose — shape what matters for tomorrow™ — we pursue excellence, collaboration, and innovation to consistently shape solutions that best serve our associates, customers, communities, and other stakeholders. to learn more, visit: www.hillenbrand.com.

assistant manager || data analyst our story so far
twelve years back, lenskart was started by a 26-year old entrepreneur - because he wanted to solve the problem of preventive blindness. we had humble beginnings - we spread awareness about eyecare, we took orders for eyeglasses online and shipped them to customers from a warehouse that was the size of a modern-day conference room.
as of today, little by little, lenskart has served 40 million people across the globe - helping them see better and lead better quality lives. simultaneously, we’ve also built ourselves up to be asia’s largest eyewear company. we have 10,000+ lenskartians worldwide, more than 1500 omni channel stores across 175 cities in india, singapore and dubai and cut to 2022 - we are shipping a pair of eyewear every 2.5 seconds, from the world’s most automated eyewear factory!
in 2022, lenskart partnered with owndays and took a majority stake in the japanese-owned eyewear player that has a deep presence in asia. with this partnership, we have added an additional 400 stores and extended our reach to 13 countries.

our key investors
softbank, adia, kedaara capital, steadview capital, premji invest, temasek, holding, kkr, alpha wave ventures, bay capital.

you: in our next chapter
we've come a long way but we're not there yet.
"good is not good enough," you'll hear lenskartians say that often. our aim is to serve one billion eyes by 2025 globally. and in this journey, we want to go beyond vision correction to transform the way people see and experience the world. that’s our new purpose - and we can only get there through cutting-edge technology and exceptional people.

lenskart is looking for a strong data & bi analyst for our central analytics team. lenskart’s business is spread across ecommerce, retail and manufacturing and a wealth of omni-channel data is generated to enable strong analytics. the role will key to unlock the value from it with use of advanced data analytics concepts.

about the team :

analytics is core to lenskart’s business across several aspects: retail & store analytics, digital & e-commerce analytics, marketing analytics, supply chain analytics, customer service, text analytics and more. s://blog.lenskart.com/introducing-analytics-lenskart-f007bd3b9c02

job responsibilities :

work closely with teams across the company to understand their data requirements and develop solutions that allow them to make data-backed decisions
develop an in-depth understanding of business performance and generate strategic insights to influence decision making
coordinate with key business stakeholders to understand the business problems and solve using strong analytics concepts
identify key metrics, conduct rigorous exploratory data analysis, create executive facing dashboards and build business cases that drive decision making and business prioritization
synthesize large volumes of data with attention to granular details and present findings and recommendations to senior-level stakeholders

minimum qualifications :
candidate needs to have 2-5 years of relevant experience, and a strong blend of analytics and soft skills
bachelor's / master's degree (mba, b.tech) from top-tier colleges
strong understanding of database designs & etl principles
strong hands on experience with sql, python/r
experience in working with analytics tools like power bi & google analytics in building dashboards and performance score cards.
strong capability to understand business problems in the context of an omni channel retail and use data to solve them.
strong stakeholder management skills and assertively manage expectations and negotiate
good to have- experience with e-commerce or product based organization
excellent communication, team-work and problem-solving skills.
we started with the aim to disrupt eyewear every step of the way and today, we stand as india’s biggest eyewear brand and now, have a global footprint across south east asia, middle east and japan.
we constantly raise the bar on our consumer experience and keep talent diversity and density at the center to help us achieve the ‘unexpected’.
#join the revolution at lenskart today!

product analyst, lucknow- asha kiran about the/nudge:
the/nudge is an action institute working towards a poverty-free india, within our lifetime. we partner with governments, markets, and civil society to build resilient livelihoods for all. we are a collective of some of india’s best leaders and entrepreneurs from across the industry, academia, government, and development sectors

about the program
the asha kiran program aims to catalyze impact at scale by partnering with private sector and government, to implement livelihood interventions for women in poor households.

who are we solving for?
women farmers from landless, marginal, and small landholders
with an average family size of 5-6 members
who have unpredictable wage labor
male members migrate for livelihood opportunities
these farmers need a diversified & sustainable income to withstand life shocks, as well as to improve their food & income security, asset value & savings, and access to safety nets and financial instruments, so as to come out of poverty.

what are we solving for?
farmers in india have experienced newer opportunities through livestock-based livelihood models promoted by govt/ markets, but there’s a need to build sustainable pro-poor models at population scale. while we are implementing livestock promotion models (backyard poultry and goatery models) in uttar pradesh, we also recognize and work towards building a deeper understanding of the value chain to create incentives for markets to participate & leverage govt resources to solve for:
infrastructure (land & assets, information & technology)
standardization of rearing practices
forward & backward linkages for farmers
collectivisation of efforts through community institutions (shgs)
organized production

at the/nudge you will:
be an integral member of the asha kiran team through a deep understanding of the practitioners’ perspective rather than an academic point of view
conduct data analysis and evidence-based decision-making
support the team in collecting and analyzing data; providing time-to-time feedback to the team, organization as well as partners. the focus will be a deep understanding of the outcomes to generate insights to help refine/enhance the work on the ground
supervise/conduct qualitative and quantitative primary and secondary research by working closely with the product, implementation, and l&d team.
create and periodically enhance quality core (macroeconomic, demographic) data depository that helps form the basis for program design and impact assessment for programs focused on livelihoods, rural development, etc.
support team in setting running monitoring and evaluation processes using different tools and techniques with a focus on the use of ict.
apply if you have:
a master’s or bachelor’s degree
at least 3 years of experience in the corporate or development sector
strong analytical and synthesis skills; experience in collecting and processing large raw datasets to provide a basis for quality analysis
working experience and expertise with data analysis applications: power bi, tableau, gsuites, excel etc
strong communication skills and a proven record of working well in teams
comfort with non-profit sector salaries
willingness to travel extensively on the field
have a strong desire to make a difference and a passion for solving hard problems
enjoy the challenge of working in a fast-paced, start-up environment
would be great if you have:
experience and working with data frameworks from international development organizations.

we aspire to be an inclusive and diverse organization and encourage qualified individuals irrespective of their religion, caste, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, ethnicity, age, or any other dimension of identity, to apply.

inventory analyst as an inventory analyst, your primary responsibility is to monitor and optimize inventory levels to ensure efficient supply chain operations. you will analyze inventory data, forecast demand, and implement strategies to minimize stockouts and excess inventory. additionally, you will collaborate with cross-functional teams to improve inventory management processes and drive cost savings.
responsibilities:
inventory analysis and planning:
analyze historical sales data, market trends, and customer demand to forecast future inventory needs.
monitor inventory levels, identifying discrepancies, and taking corrective actions to maintain accuracy.
optimize inventory levels by setting appropriate reorder points, safety stock levels, and lead times.
conduct regular inventory audits and cycle counts to ensure data accuracy and minimize discrepancies.
demand forecasting:
collaborate with sales, marketing, and operations teams to gather demand forecasts and align inventory accordingly.
utilize statistical models, forecasting tools, and market insights to accurately predict demand.
analyze demand patterns, seasonality, and sales trends to adjust inventory planning strategies.
inventory optimization:
identify slow-moving or obsolete inventory and recommend actions to minimize holding costs and improve cash flow.
evaluate suppliers' performance and lead time to ensure timely replenishment of inventory.
implement inventory control and management strategies such as abc analysis, just-in-time (jit), or economic order quantity (eoq) to optimize inventory levels.
reporting and communication:
generate regular reports and key performance indicators (kpis) related to inventory performance.
communicate inventory status, trends, and recommendations to stakeholders and management.
collaborate with cross-functional teams, such as purchasing, logistics, and finance, to align inventory strategies with overall business objectives.
qualifications:
bachelor's degree in supply chain management, logistics, business administration, or a related field.
proven experience of 7+ years as an inventory analyst or in a similar role, preferably in a fast-paced environment.
strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and draw actionable insights.
proficiency in inventory management software and enterprise resource planning (erp) systems.
knowledge of demand forecasting techniques and inventory optimization strategies.
excellent communication and presentation skills to convey complex information to various stakeholders.
detail-oriented with strong organizational and problem-solving abilities.
ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment.

ind-sr analyst about lowe’s
lowe's companies, inc. (nyse: low) is a fortune® 50 home improvement company serving approximately 17 million customer transactions a week in the u.s. with total fiscal year 2022 sales of over $97 billion, approximately $92 billion of sales were generated in the u.s., where lowe's operates over 1,700 home improvement stores and employs approximately 300,000 associates. based in mooresville, n.c., lowe's supports the communities it serves through programs focused on creating safe, affordable housing and helping to develop the next generation of skilled trade experts.
about lowe’s india: at lowe's india, we are the enablers who help create an engaging customer experience for our $97 billion home improvement business at lowe's. our 4000+ associates work across technology, analytics, business operations, finance & accounting, product management, and shared services. we leverage new technologies and find innovative methods to ensure that lowe's has a competitive edge in the market.
about the team
the collateral team is responsible for end-to-end life cycle management of in-store non-retail items (nris) such as graphics & signage, fixtures, displays, etc. a collateral is any non-retail item which is used for the support or promotion of retail products but not for sale itself. examples: bay fixtures, free-standing gondolas, cash registers, christmas decal, etc. the reporting team provides insights and analysis to internal and external stakeholders to help streamlining process and make business decisions.
core responsibilities:
identify data sources & streamline data pulls to be utilized collateral dashboard. further, build & maintain weekly, quarterly, and seasonal reporting, dashboards and scorecards.
deliver execution along with reporting within prescribed timelines with expected level of quality.
collaborate with local & global partners on regular basis to understand business area related processes/updates and bring back learnings to the team. in addition, solve for any function or business area related issues or discrepancies.
lead complex projects, while owning the transition of new process capabilities and reporting requirements.
as a functional sme, identify and drive process improvements & automation efforts by partnering with product & technology team. in addition, proactively provide insightful information like a thought leader.
monitor process audits and partner with the team on implementing preventive & corrective action items.
work with collateral production team to identity automation and streamline opportunities for the processes help in standardize the same.
work in a team environment with focus on achieving team goals vs individual goals by owning & implementing best practices.
act as a mentor for the new hires within the team, help in build strong business and functional context alongside reporting expertise.
collaborate with internal teams and global stakeholders to identify enhancement opportunities for the existing reports and scope for advancement.
create, amend and review sops and process maps for all reports.
years of experience:
5-6 years of retail experience
education qualification & certifications (optional)

bachelor’s degree with 5-6 years of relevant experience
master’s degree in data analytics / retail / operations management with 4+ years of relevant experience
skill set required
primary skills (must have)
experience in data mining and visualization tool such as powebi, excel, sql and knime / alteryx,
experience working with power app & power automate
project management (intermediate)
experience / understanding of retail industry (local or global)
strong communication skills – ability to comprehend, articulate and seamlessly communicate locally and globally
process improvement / automation experience
problem solving – ability to leverage data, information, and visuals to solve business and execution challenges. identify ways of improving process
experience working in global operating model
secondary skills (desired)
python

research analyst - maps company description

company overview
third bridge is a market-leading investment research firm. we provide integrated solutions for the world’s top investors and business leaders to help them make smarter and faster decisions. no other company in the world provides the same holistic investment offering: our superpower is the combination of human insights and unique investor-led content with a global expert network. we serve over 1,000 investment firms, offering clients 24/7 coverage through our team of 1,300+ employees located across eight offices.

job description

third bridge’s discovery is dedicated to producing and developing innovative products to address our clients' needs. we capture, map and distribute knowledge to assist our clients with their research.
the analyst position is a key enabler in the creation of the third bridge maps product, covering north american and european business entities.
reporting to manager - discovery, you will interact daily with our specialist community. as specialists are a shared resource, you will also frequently interact with forum and connections internal stakeholders who will benefit from the output generated. finally, as we are working in an agile way, you will be closely involved in business, product, data and development initiatives and will work closely with our internal product, tech and data consolidation teams.
responsibilities
your main responsibilities will be to engage with our specialist community and use our data capture tools to create maps of our specialists’ expertise. in doing so, you will assist in improving our operational processes and providing continuous feedback on our data capture and visualisation tools. you will also contribute to defining the rollout and automation strategy of our approach.
a successful candidate will have
excellent interpersonal and strong communication skills with proven experience in communicating effectively and building relationships quickly over the phone
critical, analytical and creative thinking skills, with the ability to detect areas for improvement and suggest innovative solutions
proven ability to work under pressure and at a fast pace
confidence in working autonomously and a strong work ethic to be able to work well in uncertainty
a strong interest in financial markets, research and understanding of how different businesses or industries work
sector expertise in either consumer, healthcare, tmt, industrials materials and energy, financials, or interest to develop specific expertise is a plus

qualifications
bachelor’s degree
1-3 years of experience, preferably in the financial services industry
previously worked in sales or high paced target driven environment
education or work experience directly related to commercial due diligence process would be a plus, examples - investment banking, consulting and business journalism
excellent interpersonal and strong communication skills with proven experience in communicating effectively and building relationships quickly over the phone
fluent english speaker
you should be currently based in mumbai

additional information

why work for us?
competitive compensation: enjoy a competitive salary reflective of your skills and experience.
time off: benefit from 18 days of paid time off (pto), 8 fixed holidays, 1 floating holiday, and 8 casual leaves. pto increases with tenure.
learning & development: receive a personal development reimbursment yearly for customized learning programs. additionally, a dedicated budget supports studies and job-related qualifications.
health & well-being: access private medical insurance, maternity benefits, and engage in various events promoting mental health.
life cover: automatically enrolled in life insurance cover from your date of hire, providing coverage 4x the annual ctc.
flexibility: embrace our work-from-anywhere policy, hybrid work options, and enjoy "winter fridays."
fun at work: unwind in our breakout area with games like foosball, table tennis, and playstation5.
recognition & rewards: earn points through our colleague-to-colleague recognition program, redeemable for hotels, gift cards, charity donations, and more.
snacks & refreshments: stay energized with daily snacks, tea, and coffee provided.
csr days: contribute to social responsibility with 2 csr days annually – take time off to volunteer.
equal opportunity employer: third bridge is proud to foster diversity and inclusion. all qualified applicants will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other status protected under local laws.
all your information will be kept confidential according to eeo guidelines
the successful candidate must, by the start of the employment, have permission to work in the country they are applying.
we know that to be truly innovative, we need to have a diverse team around us. that is why third bridge is committed to creating an inclusive environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. if you are not 100% sure if you are right for the role, please apply anyway and we will be happy to consider your application.

portfolio analyst overview
provide investment operations support to link fund solutions boutique fund managers, covering a range of portfolio administration functions including valuations, corporate actions, cash forecasting, performance reporting, trade settlement management, cash movements, broker and custodian liaison, and relationship management. the role needs to work in rotational shift and there would be shifts starting at 2.30 am.

key accountabilities and main responsibilities
reconciliation of cash records, positions and trades to the custodian / pb
ensuring timely delivery of various reporting requirements to fund managers
updating portfolio systems relating to investment trades, settlements, corporate actions, income receipts and cash movements

preparation of periodic reports to fund managers, their clients, and asset consultants
build and maintain effective relationships with wholesale and retail clients
liaise with custodians, fund managers and brokers
involved in project work to improve service quality such as system implementations / upgrades / testing
gross asset value (gav) production
investment types both domestic and international will include the following: equities, futures, options, fx, currency forwards, swaps, fixed income, and managed funds
experience & personal attributes
a bachelors or masters degree in business or finance or banking related discipline from a reputed college/university.
good working knowledge of microsoft office. knowledge of writing macros would be of added advantage.

good understanding of investment products, markets & securities
preferred systems knowledge – iress, omgeo, and excel
problem solving and implementing practical solutions

good organization skill with the ability to multi-task in a high-pressure environment
client focus
attention to detail, ensuring accuracy and efficiency of daily tasks and a high personal standard in all work areas
works with the team and the broader organisation towards shared goals and treats all colleagues and clients as partners

link group is a leading fund administration and share registry specialist. we are a market leading provider of technology-enabled administration solutions, continually developing our offerings to expand with our clients' needs. since our inception, link group has been entrusted by clients to handle sensitive data in a secure and confidential manner. our core businesses of fund administration and securities registration are complemented by our expertise in digital solutions and data analytics.

our hub in mumbai has people working from state-of-the-art premises and plays a strategic role by providing operations processing and technology services and support, for link group businesses across the globe. we are rapidly growing our mumbai team to build greater capability within the organisation, and provide specialised local services supported by the strength and scale of link group’s global operations and knowledge base.
link group is building a dynamic, client focused, caring and inclusive culture that is built on the foundations of an entrepreneurial spirit, effective risk management, empathy and trust, and underpinned by its core values.
we are an inclusive employer whose people work collaboratively. we encourage, support and value the various talents and perspectives of our people and promote a flexible and blended work environment where our people can thrive and their wellbeing is supported. we know that diversity drives better client outcomes, continuous improvement, and growth. be part of the link group journey and together we will achieve our full potential.

combined_text:
senior data analyst (asst. manager)- global sourcing & procurement flexible work eligible: none
discover your opportunity

data analyst - global sourcing & procurement
senior data analyst (asst. manager)- global sourcing & procurement-
gurgaon, haryana, india
the gsp (global sourcing & procurement) team supports the axa xl operations by providing sourcing and procurement services to the whole axa xl organization (65 entities 25 countries). gsp is currently on an important transformation journey aiming to put in place all the key procurement processes & tools to cover all the value chain of gsp, such as p2p (procurement to pay, contract management (contract in), vendor management, spend management… in that context, we are looking for a data analyst. the role will be strategic in the gsp organization.

discover your opportunity
what will your essential responsibilities include?
relevant experience in the field of business intelligence. expérience with the power bi tool is a must.

proficient with power bi development, deployment & maintenance.

expert in transforming data using tools like excel, python, and sql.

proficiency with excel is a must.

well versed with dbms concepts – star/snowflake schema, data modeling.

understanding elt tools like azure, and alteryx will be an added advantage.

familiarity with some of the applications like coupa, sap, and salesforce.

understanding of data science concepts like sarima, regression, and pca.

share your talent

share your talent
we’re looking for someone who has these abilities and skills:
required skills and abilities:
effective problem-solving ability:
o ability to structure a problem statement and propose a path to resolve.
o generate insights from the data.
o proactively anticipate typical data quality / ‘usability’ issues (e.g., exhaustiveness of the data, comparability of periods/scopes, currency conversion…).

good ability to synthesize / package data insights to facilitate easier communication with stakeholders and support decision-making.

ability to adapt priorities dynamically depending on business/stakeholder demands and urgency.

good understanding of all procurement processes (sourcing, contracting, vendor management…).

complex problem-solving capabilities.

excellent english written/verbal skillset for business communications/meetings with internal/external stakeholders.

find your future
axa xl, the p&c and speciality risk division of axa, is known for solving complex risks. for mid-sized companies, multinationals and even some inspirational individuals we don’t just provide re/insurance, we reinvent it.

how? by combining a comprehensive and efficient capital platform, data-driven insights, leading technology, and the best talent in an agile and inclusive workspace, empowered to deliver top client service across all our lines of business property, casualty, professional, financial lines and speciality.

with an innovative and flexible approach to risk solutions, we partner with those who move the world forward.

learn more at axaxl.com

inclusion & diversity
axa xl is committed to equal employment opportunity and will consider applicants regardless of gender, sexual orientation, age, ethnicity and origins, marital status, religion, disability, or any other protected characteristic.

at axa xl, we know that an inclusive culture and a diverse workforce enable business growth and are critical to our success. that’s why we have made a strategic commitment to attract, develop, advance and retain the most diverse workforce possible, and create an inclusive culture where everyone can bring their full selves to work and can reach their highest potential. it’s about helping one another — and our business — to move forward and succeed.

five business resource groups focused on gender, lgbtq+, ethnicity and origins, disability and inclusion with 20 chapters around the globe.
robust support for flexible working arrangements
enhanced family-friendly leave benefits
named to the diversity best practices index
signatory to the uk women in finance charter

learn more at axaxl.com/about-us/inclusion-and-diversity. axa xl is an equal opportunity employer.

sustainability

at axa xl, sustainability is integral to our business strategy. in an ever-changing world, axa xl protects what matters most for our clients and communities. we know that sustainability is at the root of a more resilient future. our 2023-26 sustainability strategy, called “roots of resilience”, focuses on protecting natural ecosystems, addressing climate change, and embedding sustainable practices across our operations.

our pillars:
valuing nature: how we impact nature affects how nature impacts us. resilient ecosystems - the foundation of a sustainable planet and society – are essential to our future. we’re committed to protecting and restoring nature – from mangrove forests to the bees in our backyard – by increasing biodiversity awareness and inspiring clients and colleagues to put nature at the heart of their plans.
addressing climate change: the effects of a changing climate are far-reaching and significant. unpredictable weather, increasing temperatures, and rising sea levels cause both social inequalities and environmental disruption. we're building a net zero strategy, developing insurance products and services, and mobilizing to advance thought leadership and investment in societal-led solutions.
integrating esg: all companies have a role to play in building a more resilient future. incorporating esg considerations into our internal processes and practices builds resilience from the roots of our business. we’re training our colleagues, engaging our external partners, and evolving our sustainability governance and reporting.
axa hearts in action: we have established volunteering and charitable giving programs to help colleagues support causes that matter most to them, known as axa xl’s “hearts in action” programs. these include our matching gifts program, volunteering leave, and our annual volunteering day – the global day of giving.

for more information, please see axaxl.com/sustainability.

axa xl is an equal opportunity employer.

business analyst - sap papm as a member of the ide – erp capability center at shell, you will have the opportunity to work in a challenging but rewarding environment that is fast paced and changing fundamentally as shell transforms its business to meet the ambition to be a net-zero emissions energy business by 2050, whilst delivering a world class business case that has a strong societal license to operate. in your ide-erp career at shell you will be expected to enact change and deliver value globally across business lines and geographies.
what’s the role
experience in delivering complete sap profitability and performance management (sap papm) solutions to the business, proficient in analyzing and translating business/process requirements to technical requirements
certain degree of knowledge in s4 hana controlling and other modules is desired
performs the configurations & ensures that build standards are adhered to best practices.
understands the erp controlling configurations & master data activities with cross functional area integration with other modules.
understanding of business requirements and develop the it solution by working along with process architects/design authorities
works with lead business analyst/process experts to develop technical design specification for solutions with high complexity
performs unit test, and supports integration test for the applicable solutions

propose any possible functional improvement in the existing solutions.
has detailed functional understanding of the application / module in their scope and how this is supporting the business process
ensure that all changes are properly and extensively documented.
fully comply with and adhere to, all group and upstream it standards and processes
where you fit in:
member of an 8-10 resources team of diverse cultural backgrounds and comprising shell staff, partners and third-party contractors
global program with collaboration across teams and customers in us, europe, russia, middle east, africa and asia pacific regions
exposure to best practice processes and world class solutions
opportunities for s4 hana skills enhancements e.g., in s4 hana oil & gas industry solutions
what we need from you
minimum 12+ years of experience in s4 hana controlling module configuration and understanding of the associated business processes.
minimum 2 e2e implementations in sap profitability and performance management (sap papm)
strong domain business knowledge in accounting & cost accounting.
understanding of defining the data models in papm, integrations (sap and non-sap systems), standard capabilities in papm and design of business rules.
understanding of cost and revenue allocation process design and implementation
good functional knowledge/experience in financial allocation processes
extensive experience in all aspects of s4 hana controlling including cca, pca, product costing and profitability analysis & material ledger
should have been a solution architect / subject matter expert in the areas of sap co
strong understanding of the co modules integration points between fi, sd, pp and mm
experience and knowledge in one or more mentioned sap technologies modules like sap bw / sap hana / sap bpc (optional)
skills with only support experience or majority of support experience will not be suitable
certain degree of knowledge in s4 hana integration with other modules will be an advantage
well versed with s4 hana system implementation methodology
dedication to meet the customer requirements and expectations, taking ownership of problems and respond in a proactive manner where appropriate.
good problem analysis skills and english communication skills, verbally and in writing.
ability to handle concurrent tasks with appropriate priority.
experience in global implementation/support of an s4 hana solution
company description
shell is a global energy company where we work towards powering progress through more and cleaner energy solutions. we use advanced technologies and take an innovative approach to help build a sustainable energy future. in india shell has its businesses footprint in information technology, projects & technology, finance operations, integrated gas, downstream & upstream spread across more than 7 main locations.
an innovative place to work
there’s never been a more exciting time to work at shell. everyone here is helping solve one of the biggest challenges facing the world today: bringing the benefits of energy to everyone on the planet, whilst managing the risks of climate change.
join us and you’ll add your talent and imagination to a business with the power to shape the future – whether by investing in renewables, exploring new ways to store energy or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently.
an inclusive place to work
to power progress together, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. here are just some of the ways we’re nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills and reach your potential.
we’re creating a space, where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply and we’ll take it from there.
we’re closing the gender gap – whether, that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.
we’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.
we consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. we encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.
a rewarding place to work
combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining shell becomes an inspired career choice.
we’re huge advocates for career development. we’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. by pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.

senior marketing operations analyst join us as we work to create a thriving ecosystem that delivers accessible, high-quality, and sustainable healthcare for all.
the senior marketing operations analyst is responsible for classifying, validating & assigning the marketing & partner leads that are entered into the crm database to appropriate sales territories. should have very strong knowledge of the us healthcare industry & be able to deep dive for information to ensure completeness of crm data. this individual will be a highly motivated, self-starter with strong knowledge of research & use of the internet to retrieve the required information. should be able to process & complete ad-hoc data quality research request within tat & accuracy, with limited guidance. have strong web research skills & decision-making capabilities to identify the trustworthy source of information.

responsibilities may include, but are not limited to:
validate & classify leads that enter the system via online & offline marketing using web research & assign them to the appropriate sales territory teams for follow ups.
process leads submitted by our partners and lock the account to the appropriate partner to ensure that they receive due credit.
must adhere to process & make process improvement suggestions. process all information provided to clean, usable data for end users.
conduct secondary research by utilizing online data sources for filling out gaps in crm data. will be responsible for data integrity checks, report anomalies, and coordinates with teams for resolution.
complete ad-hoc data quality research requests within tat with accuracy using strong decision-making capabilities, with limited guidance.
perform in-depth market research aimed at gathering data that supports marketing & sales organizations to make informed business decisions.
perform secondary market research, competitive analysis, industry and company profiling market sizing, forecasting and identifying best practices within a specific industry segment. this information should be compiled into a report which will help sales & marketing teams to take informed decisions on their strategic objectives.
adhere to timelines and quality checks and ensuring an error free deliverable
perform reliable research using a variety of trustworthy research sources.
requirements:
a dynamic personality with a drive to reach decision makers is essential. 2-5 years’ work experience in crm preferably salesforce and crm fusion tools.
any graduate / post graduate with a strong willingness to pursue a career.
healthcare technology experience preferred
high level of accuracy and attention to detail
must possess strong communication (verbal and written) and interpersonal skills as well as excellent time-management and organizational skills, with a proven ability to be highly productive and efficient in a team driven environment.
willingness to be continually challenged and learn from mistakes.
work with minimally guidance.
strong web research, data validation, problem solving and decision-making skills.
about athenahealth
here’s our vision: to create a thriving ecosystem that delivers accessible, high-quality, and sustainable healthcare for all.
what’s unique about our locations?
from an historic, 19th century arsenal to a converted, landmark power plant, all of athenahealth’s offices were carefully chosen to represent our innovative spirit and promote the most positive and productive work environment for our teams. our 10 offices across the united states and india — plus numerous remote employees — all work to modernize the healthcare experience, together.

our company culture might be our best feature.
we don't take ourselves too seriously. but our work? that’s another story. athenahealth develops and implements products and services that support us healthcare: it’s our chance to create healthier futures for ourselves, for our family and friends, for everyone.

our vibrant and talented employees — or athenistas, as we call ourselves — spark the innovation and passion needed to accomplish our goal. we continue to expand our workforce with amazing people who bring diverse backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives at every level, and foster an environment where every athenista feels comfortable bringing their best selves to work.

our size makes a difference, too: we are small enough that your individual contributions will stand out — but large enough to grow your career with our resources and established business stability.

giving back is integral to our culture. our athenagives platform strives to support food security, expand access to high-quality healthcare for all, and support stem education to develop providers and technologists who will provide access to high-quality healthcare for all in the future. as part of the evolution of athenahealth’s corporate social responsibility (csr) program, we’ve selected nonprofit partners that align with our purpose and let us foster long-term partnerships for charitable giving, employee volunteerism, insight sharing, collaboration, and cross-team engagement.

what can we do for you?
along with health and financial benefits, athenistas enjoy perks specific to each location, including commuter support, employee assistance programs, tuition assistance, employee resource groups, and collaborative workspaces — some offices even welcome dogs.

in addition to our traditional benefits and perks, we sponsor events throughout the year, including book clubs, external speakers, and hackathons. and we provide athenistas with a company culture based on learning, the support of an engaged team, and an inclusive environment where all employees are valued.

we also encourage a better work-life balance for athenistas with our flexibility. while we know in-office collaboration is critical to our vision, we recognize that not all work needs to be done within an office environment, full-time. with consistent communication and digital collaboration tools, athenahealth enables employees to find a balance that feels fulfilling and productive for each individual situation.

principal analyst - short term refinery company description

wood mackenzie are the global research, analytics, and consultancy business powering the natural resources industry. for 50 years, we have been providing the quality data, analytics, and insights our customers rely on to inspire their decision making.
our dedicated oil, gas & lng, power & renewables, chemicals, metals & mining sector teams are located around the world and deliver a variety of projects based on our assessment and valuation of thousands of individual assets, companies, and economic indicators such as market supply, demand, and price trends.
we have over 1,900 employees in 30 locations, serving customers in nearly 80 countries. together, we inspire and innovate the markets we serve – providing invaluable intelligence to help our customers overcome the toughest challenges, and make strategic decisions that will, ultimately, accelerate the world’s transition to a more sustainable future.

job description

we are looking for a principal analyst to join our short-term refining and product markets team in india. our short-term refining and product markets team is responsible for the development of the short-term outlook for refinery product supply balances and pricing analysis; a key output of our market fundamentals service. the focus of the role will be to coordinate and manage the input from our global team of refining analysts and lead our asian short-term refining and product markets outlook. you will lead the detailed analysis of the latest global and asian refining and product markets outlooks, supply fundamentals, product pricing and crude differentials. you will manage regular reports and updates on the market, authoring comprehensive topical insights and analysing current refining trends.
key responsibilities
as part of a world-class team of industry experts in the oils research team, you will analyse all aspects of the global short-term refining and products markets, assessing key events and commercial developments.
the role offers the opportunity to develop forecasting and other analytical techniques, as well as enhance your industry knowledge, by working with our experienced oils research team. you will generate a detailed view of the asian short-term refining and oil products markets, whilst working together with the broader team to develop our global view. you will be a source of insight, internally and for clients, on the structure and trends in the asian refining and products market.
as part of a team you will review, prioritise and analyse industry data and information, populate and run proprietary models to support the production of short-term refining supply, pricing and market forecasts. you will use the results of this work to produce quantitative analyses and qualitative reviews of the highest quality: thought-provoking articles, presentations, and reports.
you will become comfortable articulating wood mackenzie’s short-term refining and product markets outlook and the broader downstream oil market to clients and prospects. through research trips, client interactions and industry events you will pro-actively build your network to understand the key topics and challenges in the industry. you will address these in your contribution to our regular research deliverables and through the development of specific articles and webinars

#li-ms1

qualifications

the ideal candidate will have a refining or oil product markets background with a high degree of numeracy and analytical acumen. he or she should have the ability to work under pressure and within challenging time frames without compromising accuracy and rigor. the role offers an opportunity for the right individual to become a key member of the downstream team within wood mackenzie’s evolving global research business.
you have a keen interest in short-term commodity market dynamics, and you want to develop an in-depth understanding of how these markets operate, the risks and opportunities the industry faces.
you are highly numerate, with a strong attention to detail and proven analytical and problem-solving skills. this enables you to formulate leading-edge analysis from a variety of data and information. you are focused on continuous improvement and implementing better ways of working. experience using microsoft office (excel, power bi and powerpoint) is essential, coding experience will also be beneficial with the ability to automate data workflows.
you have effective interpersonal and communication skills. this includes the skills necessary to present your findings to industry participants at a range of levels and to effectively communicate complex and detailed market analysis with clarity and impact. you have a proven ability to work as part of a team, making a tangible contribution to team goals, involving multiple locations. you can work independently and as part of a global and regional team, generating ideas you want to share. the way in which you work is productive and driven, striving to be best in class.
the role offers an opportunity for the right individual to become a key member of the downstream team within wood mackenzie’s evolving global research business. in addition, candidates must have:
bachelor degree in a relevant discipline such as engineering, economics or related science
minimum 4 years' relevant experience in refining/ oil product markets/ oil /petroleum industry
good understanding of crude and refined products markets, trade flows, pricing
good with numbers and strong analytical skills, excellent written and verbal communication skills
previous experience working at a refinery/chemical site will be a plus

additional information

wood mackenzie values everyone’s contribution and helps them reach their full potential while sustaining an organisational culture of health and well-being.
